but it had these been equal
number of moles on both sides,

pressure, volume would
resulted in no shift.

And that wraps up Le
Chatelier's principle.
It can be a little bit tricky at first.
I highly recommend you get a fair amount
of practice going in.
Now, if you found this lesson helpful,
that like button lets YouTube know
that they should be sharing this
with other students as well.
And if you are looking for practice,

check out my "General
Chemistry Master Course,"
includes over 1200 practice questions.
